David

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
This is not a good build with those restrictions in place.

Having 20 Sorcerer levels pre-epic means that your melee abilities are severely restricted. Basically you are stuck to 2 attacks/round and a base AB of 20 (if forty levels).


All those change though if you are interested mostly on casting spells and want PM levels just for the additional defenses.

Sorcerer provides natural sunergy with the Blackguard. You can go for a (Sorcerer 26/ BG 4/ PM 10) split and get incredible defenses without having to change alignment.

Go for as much Charisma as you can, take Divine Shield with BG on a general Epic feat, and let PM give you the immunities. Don't forget to take the auto still line of feats so you can cast your spells while wearing a full plate and holding a tower shield.


All in all Blackguard will give you way more power than a Barbarian in Epic levels would do, or a Dwarven Defender for that reason. Imagine that with a base CHA of 30 (42 CHA enhanced) Blackguard will give you { +16 AC / +16 to all saves } with his abilities (Divine Shield/ Dark Blessing), as well as proficiency with heavy armor/all shields/martial weapons. In addition he will give you 1d6 sneak attack and a stacking bull's strength once per day.

To make this work even better, concetrate into the Necromany school which is also good for the theme of this character. Here is a build by Tyr that utilizes these three classes although it needs some slight adjustments (taking the BG levels in epic) to make it work in your case.

The Sorcerer King --> http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 72583.html

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Yeah, i understood that. Too many PW try to restrict the powerful prestige classes in their opinion but forget to balance that out by giving to PM's their rightful proper half-spell progression or make any changes to the rest of the classes.

Most people just play what's unrestricted (usually AA's or WM's), but few like you have the will to take upon the challenge.

That being said, this build is very powerful if you use it as a caster with unparalleled defenses, to give you an insight into what heights this build's defense can reach, imagine that 80 AC in a +5/+6 world is well within its reach.

28 (full plate + tower shield) + 20 (EMA) + 5 (shield enhancement) + 4 (haste) + 11 (divine sheild - dodge cap) + 6 (PM) = 74 AC and you have the option of expertise/improved expertise/bigby's V as well. In a +6 environment this is at least 4 higher.

And if your PW has the proper (modified) version of Tenser's then you can be a melee beast as well.
